about_the_game:
Den-Den: Tokyo Horror is an open world, survival horror experience where you play as a caregiver for the elderly. Each night for one week, you must navigate the dark streets of Tokyo, choosing where to go and whom to care for. Not everyone can be saved.

Manage your limited resources, which are needed not only for the sake of those dependent upon you, but also for your own survival. Time is not on your side, and the people have been cursed by something evil. How many deaths will be on your watch this week?

Features:

  • Explore and navigate a dystopic version of Tokyo at night, where danger and evil lurk around every street corner.

  • Time is limited, and each night you must make tough choices about where to go and whom to care for.

  • Scavenge for limited resources wherever and however you deem necessary for the survival of not only those you care for, but also yourself.

  • Enter into the homes of those whom you care for to determine their needs and meet them however you can.

  • If a person's needs are not maintained, then their body and soul will slowly become vulnerable to the lurking evil, leading to horrible outcomes such as demonic possession or death.

  • Stores and merchants can provide you with all your legal needs, while the Yakuza can supply you with your more... unconventional requests.

  • Defend yourself with a variety of weapons such as tasers, pepper spray, Shinto relics, and even guns.

content_descriptors.notes: This game contains disturbing imagery, violence, moments of self-harm and nudity.

detailed_description:
Den-Den: Tokyo Horror is an open world, survival horror experience where you play as a caregiver for the elderly. Each night for one week, you must navigate the dark streets of Tokyo, choosing where to go and whom to care for. Not everyone can be saved.

Manage your limited resources, which are needed not only for the sake of those dependent upon you, but also for your own survival. Time is not on your side, and the people have been cursed by something evil. How many deaths will be on your watch this week?

Features:

  • Explore and navigate a dystopic version of Tokyo at night, where danger and evil lurk around every street corner.

  • Time is limited, and each night you must make tough choices about where to go and whom to care for.

  • Scavenge for limited resources wherever and however you deem necessary for the survival of not only those you care for, but also yourself.

  • Enter into the homes of those whom you care for to determine their needs and meet them however you can.

  • If a person's needs are not maintained, then their body and soul will slowly become vulnerable to the lurking evil, leading to horrible outcomes such as demonic possession or death.

  • Stores and merchants can provide you with all your legal needs, while the Yakuza can supply you with your more... unconventional requests.

  • Defend yourself with a variety of weapons such as tasers, pepper spray, Shinto relics, and even guns.
name: Den-Den: Tokyo Horror

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 or 11
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 3600 (6 core with 3,5 Ghz) or Intel i5-10400F (6 core with 2,9 Ghz)
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080
  • DirectX: Version 12
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 or 11
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 7 5800x (8 core with 3,8 Ghz) or Intel i7 - 10700(8 core with 2,9 Ghz)
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce RTX 2080 or better
  • DirectX: Version 12

short_description: Den-Den: Tokyo Horror is an open world, survival horror experience where you play as a caregiver for the elderly. Navigate the dark streets of Tokyo, choosing where to go and whom to care for. Not everyone can be saved. How many deaths will be on your watch this week?
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Arabic, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Portuguese - Brazil, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Spanish - Latin America, Thai, Traditional Chinese, Turkish, Ukrainian, Vietnamese, Filipino
